document_data.name: Zakhara
document_data.caption: The moon and trailing stars—the national symbol of Zakhara.
document_data.mainbody: '''Zakhara''' ({{Pronounce|zah|KARR|ah|refs=}}), also known as the '''Land of Fate''', was a giant peninsula of the same super-continent that hosted [[Faerûn]] and [[Kara-Tur]] on the planet [[Abeir-Toril]].
document_data.Description:
The land was full of secretive cities, unwelcoming to travelers, huge deserts, lush oases and powerful [[genie]]s who meddled in the affairs of humans frequently. 

Zakhara was a land of many types of exotic magic and powerful warriors.<ref><ref> Faerûnian tales told of [[demon]]-infested cities and [[god]]less [[sorcerer (kit)|sorcerers]], like the genie-binding [[sha'ir]]s<ref> wielding strange magic.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The Land of Fate was home to a diversity of non-human inhabitants, but the majority comprised [[human]] [[Zakharan (ethnicity)|Zakharans]] with brown skin, dark hair, and relatively small height. They usually all spoke the common language of [[Midani]] and shared in the common culture of [[Zakharan pantheon|Enlightenment]]; racial values were much less prominent than elsewhere. Zakharans were firmly convinced they were more civilized than the rest of the world and treated these "barbarians" accordingly.<ref><ref>

Only a few Zakharans ventured outside their homeland, usually as traders, and could typically be found only in the very south of Faerûn.<ref> At least two human groups were the exception to this rule: the peoples of the [[Bedine]]<ref> and [[Calishite]]s came from the Land of Fate to Faerûn in the ancient past with the help of ''[[portal]]s''.<ref>
